docs.title: About Google Docs
docs.text: Google Docs is an online word processor included as part of the free, web-based Google Docs Editors suite made by Google. It is a powerful tool you can create, edit, and share your documents with.

docs.title: About the Guide
docs.text: The Guide is created to help users to get the most out of Google Docs and provide answers to possible questions.

docs.title: Manage access
docs.text:
To manage access and share a document:

  1. Open the document.
  2. Click the Share button.
  3. To allow access to the document, in the General access section, select Anyone with a link, and then select the receiver's role.

  4. Choose the way of sharing:

    • By email:

      1. In the Add people and groups field, enter the receiver's email or select the email in the dropdown list, and then click Done.
      2. In the open dialog, you can enter the message for the receiver, and then click Send. If you don't want to send a notification to the receiver, clear the Notify people checkbox, and then click Share.

    • By sending a direct link:

      1. Click the Copy link button.
      2. Paste the link where you need.

docs.title: Create documents
docs.text: You can create a Google Docs document in several ways.

docs.title: Create documents in your browser
docs.text:
To create a document in the browser:

  1. Open the Google Chrome browser.
  2. Sign in to your account.
  3. Do one of the following:
    • In the address bar, enter docs.google.com.
    • At the top right of the Google Chrome homepage, click the Google Apps icon. In the open window, click Docs.
  4. Click Blank or select a template. To view all templates, click Templates gallery.

docs.title: Create documents from your Google Drive
docs.text:
To create a document from your Google Drive:

  1. Go to your Google Drive.
  2. Click New or My Drive.
  3. In the open menu, hover over the expander arrow next to Google Docs, and then select Blank document or From template.

docs.title: Download documents
docs.text:
To download files:

  1. On the toolbar, click File.

  2. In the open menu, hover over Download, and then select the necessary file format.

  3. Select the target location for the file, and then click the Save button.

Now you've downloaded the file.

docs.title: Format the text
docs.text:
To format the text:

  1. Select the text.
  2. On the toolbar, click Format.
  3. In the open menu, hover over Text, and then perform one of the following actions:
    • To change the font style, click Bold, Italic, Underline, Strikethrough, Superscript or Subscript.
    • To change the size of the text, hover over Size, and then click Increase size or Decrease size.
    • To change the capitalization of the text, hover over Capitalization, and then click Lowercase, Uppercase or Title Case.

Alternatively, use the icons on the toolbar:

  1. Select the text.
  2. On the toolbar, click:
    • The Bold, Italic or Underline icon to change the font style.
    • The Decrease size icon or the Increase size icon to change the font size. You can also enter the necessary value in the Font size field or click the Font size field and select the value from the dropdown list.

Or use the keyboard shortcut:

Option Keyboard shortcut Bold Ctrl+B Italic Ctrl+I Underline Ctrl+U Strikethrough Alt+Shift+5 Superscript Ctrl+. Subscript Ctrl+, Decrease font size Ctrl+Shift+, Increase font size Ctrl+Shift+.

docs.title: Insert content
docs.text: Google Docs allows you to insert different types of content.

docs.title: Insert images
docs.text:
To insert an image:

  1. On the toolbar, click Insert > Image or click the Insert image icon on the toolbar.
  2. In the open menu, select the source of the image:
    • To upload the image from your computer, select Upload from computer, and then select the file.
    • To upload the image from the web, select Search the web, and then select the image in the right pane.
    • To upload the image from Google Drive, select Drive, and then select the image in the right pane.
    • To upload the image from Google Photos, select Photos, and then select the image in the right pane.
    • To upload the image using a URL address, select By URL, and then enter the URL. Click Insert image.
    • To upload the image from a camera, select Camera. Click the Capture icon to take a picture, and then click Insert.

docs.title: Insert tables
docs.text:
You can insert a custom table or choose from pre-made templates. To insert a table:

  1. On the toolbar, click Insert > Table.
  2. In the open menu, select the type of the table:
    • To create a table from a template, select Table templates. There are four options available: Product roadmap, Review tracker, Project assets, and Launch content tracker. Click the chosen template.
    • To create a custom table, hover the pointer over the gray squares. One square corresponds to one table cell. Move the pointer to select the required number of columns and rows and then click.

docs.title: Insert emojis
docs.text:
To insert an emoji:

  1. On the toolbar, click Insert > Emoji.
  2. In the dialog window, select the emoji. To find the emojii, use the search bar or click the topic tabs.

docs.title: Manage add-ons
docs.text: You can get additional features with the help of add-ons. To use an addon in your document, you need to install the add-on and turn it on.

docs.title: Install and uninstall add-ons
docs.text:
To install add-ons:

  1. Open a document.
  2. On the toolbar, click Extensions > Add-ons.
  3. Click Get add-ons.
  4. In the open window, enter the name of the add-on in the Search apps field or navigate the gallery using the filters.
  5. Click the add-on to see the full description.
  6. Click the Install button.
  7. Refresh the page or re-open the document.

Now you've installed the add-on.

Note

To view all installed add-ons, go to Extensions > Add-ons > View document add-ons.

To uninstall add-ons:

  1. Open a document.
  2. On the toolbar, click Extensions > Add-ons.
  3. Click Manage add-ons.
  4. In the open window, click the Options icon next to the necessary add-on, and then click Uninstall.

Now you've uninstalled the add-on.

docs.title: Turn on and turn off add-ons
docs.text:
To turn on add-ons:

  1. Open a document.
  2. On the toolbar, click Extensions > Add-ons.
  3. Click Manage add-ons.
  4. In the open window, click the Options icon next to the necessary add-on, and then click Use in this document.
  5. On the toolbar, click Extensions, hover over the add-on.
  6. In the open menu, click the necessary option.

Now you've turned on the add-on in the document.

To turn off add-ons:

  1. Open a document.
  2. On the toolbar, click Extensions > Add-ons.
  3. Click Manage add-ons.
  4. In the open window, click the Options icon next to the necessary add-on, and then click Use in this document to clear the check mark.

Now you've turned off the add-on in the document.

docs.title: Manage page settings
docs.text:
To manage the page settings:

  1. On the toolbar, click File.
  2. In the open menu, click Page setup.
  3. In the dialog window, edit the settings:
    • In the Page setup section, click Pages or Pageless.
    • In the Apply to section, select the area that you want your settings to apply to. You can apply the settings to the whole document or to the selected content. To apply the settings to the selected content, select the content before clicking File > Page setup.
    • In the Orientation section, select the orientation of the page. The portrait and landscape orientations are available.
    • In the Paper size section, select the size of the page from the dropdown menu.
    • In the Margins section, enter the size of the margins. The size is measured in inches.
    • In the Page color section, select the color of the page from the dropdown menu.
  4. To save your settings as default ones, click the Set as default button.
  5. Click the OK button.

Now your new page settings are applied.

docs.title: Print documents
docs.text:
To print files:

  1. Do one of the following:
    • On the toolbar, click File. In the open menu, click Print.
    • On the toolbar, click the Print icon.
    • Press Ctrl+P on your keyboard.
  2. In the open menu, select the print settings, and then click the Print button.
